name: 1.4.2 Callbacks, disable exceptions, and improvements
body:
## What's Changed
* #188 Provide polyfill for std::to_string for c++98 compatibility by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/189
* Improvements by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/191
* ARM Builds by @johnnynunez in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/192
* Implement disabling exceptions by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/195
* #197 Support CMake 4.0 by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/198
* #178 Implement optional user callbacks by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/199
* Minor re-factoring

## New Contributors
* @johnnynunez made their first contribution in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/192
* @Madrich helped designing and implementing callbacks (#178)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/compare/1.4.1...1.4.2

name: [1.2.0][Use `master` instead of releases] Conforming triangulation, bug fixes, and more.
body:
## If possible please use latest `master` instead of releases.
Releases can be outdated and can lag significantly behind the main branch. 

## What's Changed
* #54 Add function to API that extracts all edges of given triangles by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/55
* #57 Make Delaunay triangulation example obvious by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/58
* Add missing CDT_INLINE_IF_HEADER_ONLY to CalculateTriangleDepths by @kalleakerblom in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/60
* Replace use of std::random_shuffle with std::shuffle by @kalleakerblom in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/59
* Fix isFlipNeeded by @Islam0mar in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/67
* Ensure deterministic random by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/61
* Fix/export definitions by @egladil86 in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/72
* fix cdt_export.h location on install by @egladil86 in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/71
* #79 Fix KDTree to handle zero-size bounding box by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/80
* #78 Fix includes for extras by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/81
* Feature/conform to edges by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/87
* Add tests by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/89
* Add ground truth tests helpers and add a test by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/90
* Make ground truth tests data driven, fix topology neighbor indices by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/91
* Extend ground truth tests by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/92
* #84 improve erase xxx perf by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/93
* #100 Fix bug in predicates by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/101
* 86 avoid stack overflow by @artem-ogre in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/102

## New Contributors
* @kalleakerblom made their first contribution in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/60
* @Islam0mar made their first contribution in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/67
* @egladil86 made their first contribution in https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/pull/72

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/artem-ogre/CDT/compare/1.1.2...1.2

name: [v1.1.2] Performance improvements and overlapping boundaries support
body: This is a major release containing new features. ### Performance Improvements - Vertex insertion order is now randomized by default. This results in better performance overall and avoids many worst-case situations. - Boost's RTree is replaced with a custom kd-tree implementation included into CDT sources. It outperforms boost::rtree and has a significantly smaller memory footprint. - Boost RTree and nearest-random point locators are removed. - Index types used by CDT are changed to 32-bit to reduce required memory. 64-bit indices can be enabled with `CDT_USE_64_BIT_INDEX_TYPE`. Also see: Issue: #40 Pull-request: #45 ### Boost dependency is not necessary As `boost::rtree` is replaced with custom kd-tree implementation, boost is mostly needed for c++98 compatibility and not for performance. This means that most of the users will not need to enable boost. ### Overlapping boundaries support Enables handling overlaping boundaries in hole-removal algorithm. Here is an example: Algorithm tracks edges that were constrained more than once in `insertEdges`. New `PeelLayer` and `CalculateTriangleDepth` functions handle overlapping boundaries. Peel layer can now return seeds for next layer **and** deeper layers (due to overlapping boundaries). Also see: Issue: #42 Pull-request: #43 ### Other changes/fixes - README and doxygen docs are updated - #34 Do not allow flipping a fixed edge #44 - Some fixes for broken c++98 compatibility - Fixes in verifyTopology and InitializeWithGrid: #47 #48 - More fixes after 1.1.1: #51

name: [v1.0.1] Fix bug in "is edge flip required' test
body:
#### Overview 
Bug-fix release: fix an error in code that tests if an edge flip is required.
Issue: #37 
Fixing PR: #38 

#### Fix Details
Previously flip was rejected only if both vertices of flip-candidate edge belong to the super-triangle.
This sometimes resulted in wrong edges and incorrect convex-hull.
The change: instead reject the edge-flip if 
- at least one flip-candidate edge's vertex belongs to super-triangle
- original edge does not touch super-triangle.

If the case when both original edge and flip-candidate edge touch super-triangle use normal circumcircle test as a tie-breaker.

Two test files for regression testing are added.

name: [v1.0.0] CMake, custom point/edge types, custom super geometries
body:
This is a first stable version that uses modern CMake. This enables easy consumption for CMake-based projects. 

New features and improvements:
- Custom point/edge types supported in `insertVertices` and `insertEdges`
- Functionality to use any custom geometry as a target instead of a super-triangle (see `InitializeWithGrid.h`)
- Refactor calculating triangle contour depths
- Extend `RemoveDuplicatesAndRemapEdges` to also return indices duplicates
- Small performance improvements and fixes

name: qmake release
body:
Contains latest stable CDT version that uses [qmake](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qmake).
It is intended as a stable snapshot for users relying on original preprocessor defines.

Preprocessor definitions **will change** in the upcoming CMake release.
Please **do not use this release** if using the upcoming CMake release is possible.
